document_data.name: ''Blackguard's Gauntlets''
document_data.mainbody:
'''''Blackguard's gauntlets''''' were a pair of [[enchanted]] [[medium armor]] ornate-plated [[gauntlets]] that were once worn by a [[blackguard]] and later by a [[death knight]] they became.

{{quote|''For some [[paladin]]s, the [[iron]]-clad grip that an [[oath]] holds can be too much to bear. When these [[champion]]s fail and falter, their hands that would guide turn cold, hard, and piercing.''}}
document_data.Powers: ''Blackguard's gauntlets'' allowed the wearer to cast an empowered version of the ''[[inflict wounds]]'' [[spell]] once per day. Additionally, the gauntlets increased the wearer's physical strength and magically guided their hands and weapons towards the targets, similarly to that of ''+1'' offensive enchantments.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, ''blackguard's gauntlets'' were worn by the guardian death knight called [[That Which Watches]], who, along with [[That Which Guards]] and [[That Which Lurks (death knight)|That Which Lurks]], guarded the entrance to the chamber of the [[Bhaalist]] [[Murder Tribunal]] in the [[Undercellar]] of [[Baldur's Gate]].
